answers.answer: Thank you for passing on this information.

question: Was any one looking for patient assistance programand in need of diabetic testing supplies because they have no insurance, I found this info for my Brother and thought i would pass it on.I found it on needymeds.comProgram Name Abbott Diabetes Patient Assistance ProgramProgram Address Address on application,Phone Number 866-224-8887Fax Number None AvailableEmailDiseases DiabetesWeb Site Go to WebsiteDetails This program provides free FreeStyle Flash Meter Blood Glucose Monitoring System, FreeStyle Blood Glucose Monitoring System, or Precision Xtra Blood Glucose and Ketone Monitoring System, Strips, and Lancets to eligible applicant.Eligibility Guidelines  The applicant must have applied to Medicaid, been denied, have no prescription insurance and meet income guidelines that are not disclosed.How To Apply The applicant must call for a prescreening, then an application will be sent out. The completed application must be sent in with a doctor's note about testing requirements, proof of income and a denial letter from Medicaid.Area of Service NationalLast Updated January 19, 2006I hope this will help many of you out there, please pass it on if you know someone that can use this help.Thanks, Yodasaan
title: Found info for diabetic supplies free if no ins and inc low enough
